intro: Monnina killipii, commonly known as Killip's monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, and it has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Monnina killipii is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky areas and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
